## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**AI Assistant:**
Hi! I'm here to help you with any questions about Verus. What's on your mind today?

**User:**
Yeah, I was wondering about the disclaimer associated with this software?

**AI Assistant:**
This software is experimental and unfinished, and it is used at your own risk. There is no warranty for any kind of damage. However, permission is granted to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies of the software, subject to certain conditions. So, please be aware of the experimental nature of the software and use it responsibly.

**User:**
That makes sense. I was also wondering about creating a PBaaS chain with a name that is already supported by Verus Desktop. Are there any limitations?

**AI Assistant:**
Yes, in the GUI, if a currency is already supported by Verus Desktop, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. However, this limitation is considered errata for this testnet release and will not be a limitation before mainnet availability. So, you'll be able to use those names in the future, but not for now.

**User:**
Okay, got it. What about creating a currency from an ID with an i-address as its name? Are there any limitations there?

**AI Assistant:**
Yes, there are limitations when creating a currency from an ID with an i-address as its name. Specifically, you will not be able to make a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. This is because using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. So, you'll need to be careful with how you name your IDs and currencies.

**User:**
I see. What's the purpose of the `returntx` option when registering an identity?

**AI Assistant:**
The `returntx` option is used to receive a raw transaction that needs to be signed by the identity owner when registering an identity. This is required if the currency's ID issuance requires permission from the currency's identity. So, it's a way to get the necessary transaction to sign and complete the registration process.

**User:**
Lastly, how do I register an identity on the Verus testnet using the command line?

**AI Assistant:**
To register an identity on the Verus testnet using the command line, you can use the following command:

```
verus -chain=vrsctest registeridentity '{"txid": "67635331cbccb7a2cbf408a9e97b3f8986133964e0315a8b9fd237a5fd95ac8f","namereservation": { "version": 1, "name": "ID", "parent": "i84mndBk2Znydpgm9T9pTjVvBnHkhErzLt", "salt": "b7070f2ca7495e49c85ab41b5a368150e2c217be6d08cc4102a1b682cddb6f01", "referral": ""},"identity":{"primaryaddresses":["RDnf7mH7RQki9b7PqdBD2Er6WXv3DTawGr"],"minimumsignatures":1,"name":"ID","parent":"vrsc-btc@"}}' false 0 zs1s2mteau9tcalvk55cnepw3aq7dr6w7f447pqqkxczat3a02208d3ersx60wz9srw3nkd25ppfny
```

This command registers an identity with the specified name, parent, and other properties. Make sure to replace the placeholders with your own values!

verus -chain=vrsctest registeridentity '{"txid": "67635331cbccb7a2cbf408a9e97b3f8986133964e0315a8b9fd237a5fd95ac8f","namereservation": { "version": 1, "name": "ID", "parent": "i84mndBk2Znydpgm9T9pTjVvBnHkhErzLt", "salt": "b7070f2ca7495e49c85ab41b5a368150e2c217be6d08cc4102a1b682cddb6f01", "referral": ""},"identity":{"primaryaddresses":["RDnf7mH7RQki9b7PqdBD2Er6WXv3DTawGr"],"minimumsignatures":1,"name":"ID","parent":"vrsc-btc@"}}' false 0 zs1s2mteau9tcalvk55cnepw3aq7dr6w7f447pqqkxczat3a02208d3ersx60wz9srw3nkd25ppfny ``` If a currency's ID issuance require permission from the currency's identity then it must sign the name commitment and identity registration. Either use the parent identity to fund those transactions, or receive a raw transaction to give the identity owner to sign by setting `returntx` to `true`#### Limitations in multi-currency to be aware of: 1. (GUI and CLI) You will not be able to make a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. Generally, the advice is “don’t do that”. Using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. As a general rule, making an ID with an i-address as its name is not prevented by the protocol, but will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used (many cases) and will not be supported for creating currencies. To reduce any potential for user confusion, even though the naming system provides will also be expanding the set of characters that will not be allowed for currency registrations.2. (GUI) If a currency is supported in the Verus Desktop already, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. This limitation is considered errata for this testnet release and will not be a limitation before mainnet availability.### DisclaimerThis is experimental and unfinished software. How do I register an identity on the Verus testnet using the command line?

To register an identity on the Verus testnet using the command line, you can use the following command:

```
verus -chain=vrsctest registeridentity '{"txid": "67635331cbccb7a2cbf408a9e97b3f8986133964e0315a8b9fd237a5fd95ac8f","namereservation": { "version": 1, "name": "ID", "parent": "i84mndBk2Znydpgm9T9pTjVvBnHkhErzLt", "salt": "b7070f2ca7495e49c85ab41b5a368150e2c217be6d08cc4102a1b682cddb6f01", "referral": ""},"identity":{"primaryaddresses":["RDnf7mH7RQki9b7PqdBD2Er6WXv3DTawGr"],"minimumsignatures":1,"name":"ID","parent":"vrsc-btc@"}}' false 0 zs1s2mteau9tcalvk55cnepw3aq7dr6w7f447pqqkxczat3a02208d3ersx60wz9srw3nkd25ppfny
```

This command registers an identity with the specified name, parent, and other properties.

verus -chain=vrsctest registeridentity '{"txid": "67635331cbccb7a2cbf408a9e97b3f8986133964e0315a8b9fd237a5fd95ac8f","namereservation": { "version": 1, "name": "ID", "parent": "i84mndBk2Znydpgm9T9pTjVvBnHkhErzLt", "salt": "b7070f2ca7495e49c85ab41b5a368150e2c217be6d08cc4102a1b682cddb6f01", "referral": ""},"identity":{"primaryaddresses":["RDnf7mH7RQki9b7PqdBD2Er6WXv3DTawGr"],"minimumsignatures":1,"name":"ID","parent":"vrsc-btc@"}}' false 0 zs1s2mteau9tcalvk55cnepw3aq7dr6w7f447pqqkxczat3a02208d3ersx60wz9srw3nkd25ppfny ``` If a currency's ID issuance require permission from the currency's identity then it must sign the name commitment and identity registration. Either use the parent identity to fund those transactions, or receive a raw transaction to give the identity owner to sign by setting `returntx` to `true`#### Limitations in multi-currency to be aware of: 1. (GUI and CLI) You will not be able to make a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. Generally, the advice is “don’t do that”.
